alert.note: Alert for Greeley; Logan; Wallace; Wichita (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued March 28 at 3:07PM CDT until March 30 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Dangerous fire weather conditions over portions of the Tri State region Thursday afternoon and evening... .A strong low pressure system will set up over eastern Colorado on Thursday shifting northeast through the region during the day. South of this system above normal warmth with temperatures in the 70s, combined with strong southwest downslope flow, will create very dry conditions for area fuels. The focus for these conditions may occur in Cheyenne county in Colorado as well as Greeley, Wichita, Wallace and Logan counties in northwest Kansas. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 027, 028, 041, 042, AND 254... * Affected Area...In Colorado, Fire Weather Zone 254 Cheyenne. In Kansas, Fire Weather Zone 027 Wallace, Fire Weather Zone 028 Logan, Fire Weather Zone 041 Greeley and Fire Weather Zone 042 Wichita. * Winds...Southwest 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph. * Relative Humidity...As low as 11 percent. * Impacts...Any fires that start will have extreme fire behavior and spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not advised.
info.instruction: Continue to monitor the forecast for the latest updates. Be prepared to adjust any plans for burning or activities that may create sparks.
